155/**
156 *  The annotation processor for the {@code org.tquadrat.foundation.config}
157 *  module.
158 *
159 *  @version $Id: ConfigAnnotationProcessor.java 1010 2022-02-05 19:28:36Z tquadrat $
160 *
161 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
162 *  @UMLGraph.link
163 *  @since 0.1.0
164 */
165@SuppressWarnings( {"OverlyCoupledClass", "OverlyComplexClass", "ClassWithTooManyMethods"} )
166@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: ConfigAnnotationProcessor.java 1010 2022-02-05 19:28:36Z tquadrat $" )
167@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
168@SupportedSourceVersion( SourceVersion.RELEASE_17 )
169@SupportedOptions( { APBase.ADD_DEBUG_OUTPUT, APBase.MAVEN_GOAL } )
170public class ConfigAnnotationProcessor extends APBase
171{

474    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
475        \*------------*/
476    /**
477     *  <p>{@summary The base bundle name.} The value will be set in
478     *  {@link #process(Set, RoundEnvironment)}
479     *  from a String constant that is annotated with the annotation
480     *  {@link BaseBundleName &#64;BaseBundleName}.</p>
481     */
482    @SuppressWarnings( "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType" )
483    private Optional<String> m_BaseBundleName;
484
485    /**
486     *  <p>{@summary The message prefix.} The value will be set in
487     *  {@link #process(Set, RoundEnvironment)}
488     *  from a String constant that is annotated with the annotation
489     *  {@link MessagePrefix &#64;MessagePrefix}.</p>
490     */
491    @SuppressWarnings( "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType" )
492    private Optional<String> m_MessagePrefix;
493
494    /**
495     *  The preferences accessor classes.
496     */
497    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.1.0" )
498    private final Map<TypeName,ClassName> m_PrefsAccessorClasses;
499
500    /**
501     *  A map of
502     *  {@link StringConverter}
503     *  implementations that use instances of
504     *  {@link TypeName}
505     *  as keys.
506     */
507    private final LazyMap<TypeName,ClassName> m_StringConvertersForTypeNames;
508
509        /*--------------*\
510    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
511        \*--------------*/
512    /**
513     *  Creates a new {@code ConfigAnnotationProcessor} instance.
514     */
515    public ConfigAnnotationProcessor()
516    {
517        super();
518
519        m_StringConvertersForTypeNames = LazyMap.use( true, this::initStringConvertersForTypeNames );
520
521        final var buffer = new HashMap<TypeName,ClassName>();
522        for( final var entry : ClassRegistry.m_PrefsAccessorClasses.entrySet() )
523        {
524            buffer.put( TypeName.from( entry.getKey() ), ClassName.from( entry.getValue() ) );
525        }
526        m_PrefsAccessorClasses = Map.copyOf( buffer );
527    }   //  ConfigAnnotationProcessor()
528

565    public static final TypeName PREFS_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
566
567    /**
568     *  The type name for the class
569     *  {@link SetAccessor}.
570     */
571    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.1.0" )
572    public static final TypeName SET_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
573
574    static
575    {
576        DEFAULT_ACCESSOR_TYPE = ClassName.from( SimplePreferenceAccessor.class );
577        ENUM_ACCESSOR_TYPE = ClassName.from( EnumAccessor.class );
578        LIST_ACCESSOR_TYPE = ClassName.from( ListAccessor.class );
579        MAP_ACCESSOR_TYPE = ClassName.from( MapAccessor.class );
580        PREFS_ACCESSOR_TYPE = ClassName.from( PreferenceAccessor.class );
581        SET_ACCESSOR_TYPE = ClassName.from( SetAccessor.class );
582    }
583
584        /*---------*\
585    ====** Methods **==========================================================
586        \*---------*/
587    /**
588     *  Checks whether the given type is inappropriate for a configuration bean
589     *  property and therefore deserves that an
590     *  {@link InappropriateTypeError}
591     *  is thrown.
592     *
593     *  @param  typeName    The type to check.
594     *  @throws InappropriateTypeError  The given type may not be chosen for
595     *      a configuration bean property.
596     *
597     *  @see    InputStream
598     *  @see    Stream
599     *  @see    DoubleStream
600     *  @see    IntStream
601     *  @see    LongStream
602     */
603    private final void checkAppropriate( final TypeMirror typeName ) throws InappropriateTypeError
604    {
605        KindSwitch: switch( requireNonNullArgument( typeName, "type" ).getKind() )
606        {
607            case ARRAY ->
608            {
609                //---* Check the component type *------------------------------
610                final var componentType = typeName.accept( new SimpleTypeVisitor14<TypeMirror,Void>()
611                {
612                    /**
613                     *  {@inheritDoc}
614                     */
615                    @Override
616                    public final TypeMirror visitArray( final ArrayType arrayType, final Void ignore )
617                    {
618                        return arrayType.getComponentType();
619                    }   //  visitArray()
620                }, null );
621
622                if( nonNull( componentType ) ) checkAppropriate( componentType );
623            }
624
625            case BOOLEAN, BYTE, CHAR, DOUBLE, FLOAT, INT, LONG, SHORT ->
626            { /* The primitives work just fine */}
627
628            case DECLARED ->
629            {
630                final var erasure = getTypeUtils().erasure( typeName );
631                final var unwantedTypes = List.of( DoubleStream.class, IntStream.class, LongStream.class, InputStream.class, Stream.class );
632                final var isInappropriate = unwantedTypes.stream()
633                    .map( Class::getName )
634                    .map( n -> getElementUtils().getTypeElement( n ) )
635                    .map( Element::asType )
636                    .map( e -> getTypeUtils().erasure( e ) )
637                    .anyMatch( t -> getTypeUtils().isAssignable( erasure, t ) );
638                if( isInappropriate ) throw new InappropriateTypeError( TypeName.from( typeName ) );
639            }
640
641            default -> throw new UnsupportedEnumError( typeName.getKind() );
642        }   //  KindSwitch:
643    }   //  checkAppropriate()
644
645    /**
646     *  <p>Composes the name of the field from the given property name.</p>
647     *
648     *  @param  propertyName    The name of the property.
649     *  @return The name of the field.
650     */
651    private static final String composeFieldName( final String propertyName )
652    {
653        final var retValue = format( "m_%s", capitalize( propertyName ) );
654
655        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
656        return retValue;
657    }   //  composeFieldName()
658
659    /**
660     *  <p>{@summary Creates a registry of the known
661     *  {@link StringConverter}
662     *  implementations.}</p>
663     *  <p>The
664     *  {@link TypeName}
665     *  of the subject class is the key for that map, the {@code TypeName} for
666     *  the {@code Class} implementing the {@code StringConverter} is the
667     *  value.</p>
668     *
669     *  @return An immutable map of
670     *      {@link StringConverter}
671     *      implementations.
672     *
673     *  @throws IOException Failed to read the resource files with the
674     *      {@code StringConverter} implementations.
675     */
676    @SuppressWarnings( "NestedTryStatement" )
677    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.1.0" )
678    public static final Map<TypeName,ClassName> createStringConverterRegistry() throws IOException
679    {
680        final Map<TypeName,ClassName> buffer = new HashMap<>();
681
682        /*
683         * For some reason, the original code for this method does not work:
684         *
685         * for( final var c : StringConverter.list() )
686         * {
687         *    final var container = StringConverter.forClass( c );
688         *    if( container.isPresent() )
689         *    {
690         *       final var stringConverterClass = TypeName.from( container.get().getClass() );
691         *       final var key = TypeName.from( c );
692         *       buffer.put( key, stringConverterClass );
693         *       ifDebug( "StringConverters: %1$s => %2$s"::formatted, key, stringConverterClass );
694         *    }
695         * }
696         *
697         * This code relies on the code in the foundation-util module, so I
698         * assumed the problem there and move the code to here:
699         *
700         * final var moduleLayer = StringConverter.class.getModule().getLayer();
701         * final var converters = isNull( moduleLayer )
702         *   ? ServiceLoader.load( StringConverter.class )
703         *   : ServiceLoader.load( moduleLayer, StringConverter.class );
704         *
705         * for( final StringConverter<?> c : converters )
706         * {
707         *   StringConverter<?> converter;
708         *   try
709         *   {
710         *     final var providerMethod = c.getClass().getMethod( METHOD_NAME_Provider );
711         *     converter = (StringConverter<?>) providerMethod.invoke( null );
712         *   }
713         *   catch( final NoSuchMethodException | IllegalAccessException | InvocationTargetException e )
714         *   {
715         *     converter = c;
716         *   }
717         *
718         *   for( final var subjectClass : retrieveSubjectClasses( converter ) )
719         *   {
720         *     buffer.put( TypeName.from( subjectClass ), TypeName.from( converter.getClass() ) );
721         *   }
722         * }
723         *
724         * I raised a question on StackOverflow regarding this issue:
725         *   https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70861635/java-util-serviceloader-does-not-work-inside-of-an-annotationprocessor
726         */
727
728        final var classLoader = CodeGenerationConfiguration.class.getClassLoader();
729        final var resources = classLoader.getResources( format( "META-INF/services/%s", StringConverter.class.getName() ) );
730        for( final var file : list( resources ) )
731        {
732            try( final var reader = new BufferedReader( new InputStreamReader( file.openStream() ) ) )
733            {
734                final var converterClasses = reader.lines()
735                    .map( String::trim )
736                    .filter( l -> !l.startsWith( "#" ) )
737                    .map( l -> loadClass( classLoader, l, StringConverter.class ) )
738                    .filter( Optional::isPresent )
739                    .map( Optional::get )
740                    .toList();
741                CreateLoop: for( final var c : converterClasses )
742                {
743                    try
744                    {
745                        final var constructor = c.getConstructor();
746                        final var instance = constructor.newInstance();
747                        for( final var subjectClass : retrieveSubjectClasses( instance ) )
748                        {
749                            buffer.put( TypeName.from( subjectClass ), ClassName.from( c ) );
750                        }
751                    }
752                    catch( final InvocationTargetException | NoSuchMethodException |InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException e )
753                    {
754                        ifDebug( e );
755
756                        //---* Deliberately ignored! *-------------------------
757                        continue CreateLoop;
758                    }
759                }   //  CreateLoop:
760            }
761        }
762
763        final var retValue = Map.copyOf( buffer );
764
765        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
766        return retValue;
767    }   //  createStringConverterRegistry()
768
769    /**
770     *  Determines whether the given
771     *  {@link TypeMirror type}
772     *  is a collection of some type and returns the respective kind.
773     *
774     *  @param  type The type to check.
775     *  @return The collection kind.
776     */
777    private final CollectionKind determineCollectionKind( final TypeMirror type )
778    {
779        final var focusType = getTypeUtils().erasure( requireNonNullArgument( type, "type" ) );
780
781        final var listType = getTypeUtils().erasure( getElementUtils().getTypeElement( List.class.getName() ).asType() );
782        final var mapType = getTypeUtils().erasure( getElementUtils().getTypeElement( Map.class.getName() ).asType() );
783        final var setType = getTypeUtils().erasure( getElementUtils().getTypeElement( Set.class.getName() ).asType() );
784
785        var retValue = NO_COLLECTION;
786        if( getTypeUtils().isAssignable( focusType, listType ) ) retValue = LIST;
787        if( getTypeUtils().isAssignable( focusType, mapType ) ) retValue = MAP;
788        if( getTypeUtils().isAssignable( focusType, setType ) ) retValue = SET;
789
790        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
791        return retValue;
792    }   //  determineCollectionKind()
793
794    /**
795     *  <p>{@summary Retrieves the name of the property from the name of the
796     *  given executable element for a method that is either a getter, a setter
797     *  or an 'add' method.}</p>
798     *  <p>Alternatively the method has an annotation that provides the name of
799     *  the property.</p>
800     *
801     *  @param  method  The method.
802     *  @return The name of the property.
803     *
804     *  @see PropertyName
805     *  @see SpecialProperty
806     *  @see SpecialPropertyType
807     */
808    private final String determinePropertyNameFromMethod( @SuppressWarnings( "TypeMayBeWeakened" ) final ExecutableElement method )
809    {
810        final String retValue;
811        final var specialPropertyAnnotation = method.getAnnotation( SpecialProperty.class );
812        final var propertyNameAnnotation = method.getAnnotation( PropertyName.class );
813        if( nonNull( specialPropertyAnnotation ) )
814        {
815            if( nonNull( propertyNameAnnotation ) )
816            {
817                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, PropertyName.class.getName(), method.getSimpleName() ) );
818            }
819            final var specialPropertyType = specialPropertyAnnotation.value();
820            retValue = specialPropertyType.getPropertyName();
821        }
822        else
823        {
824            if( nonNull( propertyNameAnnotation ) )
825            {
826                retValue = propertyNameAnnotation.value();
827            }
828            else
829            {
830                final var methodName = method.getSimpleName().toString();
831
832                /*
833                 * We know that the method is either a getter, a setter or an 'add'
834                 * method. Therefore, we know also that the name starts either with
835                 * "get", "set", "add" or "is".
836                 */
837                final var pos = methodName.startsWith( PREFIX_IS ) ? PREFIX_IS.length() : PREFIX_GET.length();
838                retValue = decapitalize( methodName.substring( pos ) );
839            }
840        }
841
842        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
843        return retValue;
844    }   //  determinePropertyNameFromMethod()
845
846    /**
847     *  <p>{@summary Determines the property type from the given
848     *  {@link TypeMirror} instance.} This is either the return type of a
849     *  getter or the argument type of a setter.</p>
850     *  <p>Usually the property type will be the respective
851     *  {@link TypeName}
852     *  for the given type as is, only in case of
853     *  {@link Optional},
854     *  it will be the parameter type.</p>
855     *
856     *  @param  type   The type.
857     *  @return The property type.
858     */
859    private final TypeMirror determinePropertyType( final TypeMirror type )
860    {
861        var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( type, "type" );
862        final var optionalType = getTypeUtils().erasure( getElementUtils().getTypeElement( Optional.class.getName() ).asType() );
863        if( getTypeUtils().isAssignable( getTypeUtils().erasure( retValue ), optionalType ) )
864        {
865            /*
866             * The return type is Optional, we need to get the type parameter
867             * and have to look at that.
868             */
869            final var genericTypes = retrieveGenericTypes( retValue );
870            if( genericTypes.size() == 1 ) retValue = genericTypes.get( 0 );
871        }
872
873        //---* Check whether the property type is appropriate *----------------
874        checkAppropriate( retValue );
875
876        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
877        return retValue;
878    }   //  determinePropertyType()
879
880    /**
881     *  Determines the implementation of
882     *  {@link StringConverter}
883     *  that can translate a String into an instance of the given type and
884     *  vice-versa.
885     *
886     *  @param  method  The annotated method; it is only used to get the
887     *      instance of
888     *      {@link StringConversion &#64;StringConversion}
889     *      from it.
890     *  @param  type    The target type.
891     *  @param  isEnum  {@code true} if the target type is an
892     *      {@link Enum enum}
893     *      type, {@code false} otherwise.
894     *  @return An instance of
895     *      {@link Optional}
896     *      that holds the determined class.
897     */
898    private final Optional<ClassName> determineStringConverterClass( final ExecutableElement method, final TypeName type, final boolean isEnum )
899    {
900        requireNonNullArgument( type, "type" );
901        requireNonNullArgument( method, "method" );
902        ifDebug( a -> format( "Method: %2$s%n\tType for StringConverter request: %1$s%n\tisEnum: %3$b", a [0].toString(), ((Element) a[1]).getSimpleName(), a [2] ), type, method, Boolean.valueOf( isEnum ) );
903
904        //---* Retrieve the StringConverter from the annotation *--------------
905        final var retValue = extractStringConverterClass( method )
906            .or( () -> Optional.ofNullable( isEnum ? ClassName.from( EnumStringConverter.class ) : m_StringConvertersForTypeNames.get( type ) ) );
907        //noinspection unchecked
908        ifDebug( a -> ((Optional<TypeName>) a [0]).map( "Detected StringConverter: %1$s"::formatted ).orElse( "Could not find a StringConverter" ), retValue );
909
910        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
911        return retValue;
912    }   //  determineStringConverterClass
913
914    /**
915     *  <p>{@summary Retrieves the value for the
916     *  {@link StringConversion &#64;StringConversion}
917     *  annotation from the given method.}</p>
918     *  <p>The type for the annotation value is an instance of
919     *  {@link Class Class&lt;? extends StringConverter&gt;},
920     *  so it cannot be retrieved directly. Therefore this method will return
921     *  the
922     *  {@link TypeName}
923     *  for the
924     *  {@link StringConverter}
925     *  implementation class.</p>
926     *
927     *  @param  method  The annotated method.
928     *  @return An instance of
929     *      {@link Optional}
930     *      holding the type name that represents the annotation value
931     *      &quot;<i>stringConverter</i>&quot;.
932     */
933    public final Optional<ClassName> extractStringConverterClass( final ExecutableElement method )
934    {
935        final var retValue = getAnnotationMirror( requireNonNullArgument( method, "method" ), StringConversion.class )
936            .flatMap( this::getAnnotationValue )
937            .map( annotationValue -> TypeName.from( (TypeMirror) annotationValue.getValue() ) )
938            .map( TypeName::toString )
939            .map( JavaUtils::loadClass )
940            .filter( Optional::isPresent )
941            .map( Optional::get )
942            .map( ClassName::from );
943
944        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
945        return retValue;
946    }   //  extractStringConverterClass()
947
948    /**
949     *  {@inheritDoc}
950     */
951    @Override
952    protected final Collection<Class<? extends Annotation>> getSupportedAnnotationClasses()
953    {
954        final Collection<Class<? extends Annotation>> retValue =
955            List.of( ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class );
956
957        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
958        return retValue;
959    }   //  getSupportedAnnotationClasses()
960
961    /**
962     *  Processes the given
963     *  {@link ExecutableElement}
964     *  instance for an 'add' method.
965     *
966     *  @param  configuration   The code generation configuration.
967     *  @param  addMethod   The 'add' method.
968     */
969    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
970    private final void handleAddMethod( final CodeGenerationConfiguration configuration, final ExecutableElement addMethod )
971    {
972        //---* Get the method name *-------------------------------------------
973        final var addMethodName = addMethod.getSimpleName();
974
975        //---* Check for unwanted annotations *--------------------------------
976        @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
977        Class<? extends Annotation> [] unwantedAnnotations = new Class[]
978        {
979            SystemProperty.class,
980            EnvironmentVariable.class,
981            SystemPreference.class,
982            Preference.class,
983            NoPreference.class,
984            Argument.class,
985            Option.class,
986            INIValue.class
987        };
988        for( final var annotationClass : unwantedAnnotations )
989        {
990            if( nonNull( addMethod.getAnnotation( annotationClass ) ) )
991            {
992                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnAddMethod, annotationClass.getName(), addMethodName ) );
993            }
994        }
995
996        /*
997         * If the 'add' method is default, our job is mostly done already.
998         */
999        final var isDefault = addMethod.getModifiers().contains( DEFAULT );
1000        if( isDefault )
1001        {
1002            //noinspection unchecked
1003            unwantedAnnotations = new Class[]
1004                {
1005                    CheckEmpty.class,
1006                    CheckNull.class,
1007                    SpecialProperty.class
1008                };
1009            for( final var annotationClass : unwantedAnnotations )
1010            {
1011                if( nonNull( addMethod.getAnnotation( annotationClass ) ) )
1012                {
1013                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnAddMethod, annotationClass.getName(), addMethodName ) );
1014                }
1015            }
1016        }
1017        else
1018        {
1019            //---* Get the property name *-------------------------------------
1020            final var propertyName = determinePropertyNameFromMethod( addMethod );
1021
1022            /*
1023             * As we cannot infer the property type from an add method, it is
1024             * required that we already have a property specification for this
1025             * property.
1026             */
1027            final var property = (PropertySpecImpl) configuration.getProperty( propertyName )
1028                .orElseThrow( () -> new org.tquadrat.foundation.ap.CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_MissingPropertyDefinition, propertyName, addMethodName ) ) );
1029
1030            //---* Only collections may have 'add' methods *-------------------
1031            if( property.getCollectionKind() == NO_COLLECTION )
1032            {
1033                throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_AddMethodNotAllowed, addMethodName ) );
1034            }
1035
1036            //---* Immutable special properties may not have an add method *---
1037            if( property.hasFlag( PROPERTY_IS_SPECIAL ) )
1038            {
1039                property.getSpecialPropertyType()
1040                    .map( CodeGenerator::getSpecialPropertySpecification )
1041                    .filter( spec -> spec.hasFlag( PROPERTY_IS_MUTABLE ) )
1042                    .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_IllegalMutator, propertyName ) ) );
1043            }
1044
1045            //---* Save the method name and variable name *--------------------
1046            property.setAddMethodName( addMethodName );
1047            property.setAddMethodArgumentName( retrieveSetterArgumentName( addMethod ) );
1048
1049            //---* We have an add method, so the property is mutable *---------
1050            property.setFlag( PROPERTY_IS_MUTABLE );
1051            if( configuration.getSynchronizationRequired() ) property.setFlag( PROPERTY_REQUIRES_SYNCHRONIZATION );
1052
1053            /*
1054             * For a special property, all the definitions are made there, so
1055             * nothing to do here â¦
1056             */
1057            if( !property.hasFlag( PROPERTY_IS_SPECIAL ) )
1058            {
1059                final var propertyType = property.getPropertyType();
1060                if( isNull( propertyType ) )
1061                {
1062                    throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_NoType, addMethodName, propertyName ) );
1063                }
1064
1065                /*
1066                 * Get the StringConverter; as this cannot be inferred it has to be
1067                 * taken from the annotation @StringConversion, if present. And
1068                 * then it will override the already set one.
1069                 */
1070                extractStringConverterClass( addMethod )
1071                    .ifPresent( property::setStringConverterClass );
1072            }
1073
1074            /*
1075             * Shall the property be added to the result of toString()?
1076             */
1077            if( nonNull( addMethod.getAnnotation( ExemptFromToString.class ) ) )
1078            {
1079                property.setFlag( EXEMPT_FROM_TOSTRING );
1080            }
1081
1082            //---* â¦ and now we create the method spec *-----------------------
1083            final var methodBuilder = configuration.getComposer()
1084                .overridingMethodBuilder( addMethod );
1085            property.setAddMethodBuilder( methodBuilder );
1086        }
1087    }   //  handleAddMethod()
1088
1089    /**
1090     *  Processes the given
1091     *  {@link ExecutableElement}
1092     *  instance for a getter method.
1093     *
1094     *  @param  configuration   The code generation configuration.
1095     *  @param  getter  The getter method.
1096     */
1097    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1098    private final void handleGetter( final CodeGenerationConfiguration configuration, final ExecutableElement getter )
1099    {
1100        //---* Get the property name *-----------------------------------------
1101        final var propertyName = determinePropertyNameFromMethod( getter );
1102
1103        /*
1104         * Create the new property spec and store it. The getters will be
1105         * created first, so a property with the same name, defined by another
1106         * getter, may not exist already. The respective check is made on
1107         * storing.
1108         */
1109        final var property = new PropertySpecImpl( propertyName );
1110        configuration.addProperty( property );
1111
1112        //---* Keep the name of the getter method *----------------------------
1113        final var getterMethodName = getter.getSimpleName();
1114        property.setGetterMethodName( getterMethodName );
1115
1116        //---* Shall the property be added to the result of toString()? *------
1117        if( nonNull( getter.getAnnotation( ExemptFromToString.class ) ) )
1118        {
1119            property.setFlag( EXEMPT_FROM_TOSTRING );
1120        }
1121
1122        //---* Default getters are handled differently *-----------------------
1123        final var isDefault = getter.getModifiers().contains( DEFAULT );
1124        if( isDefault )
1125        {
1126            /*
1127             * Several annotations are not allowed for a default getter.
1128             */
1129            @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
1130            final Class<? extends Annotation> [] unwantedAnnotations = new Class[]
1131            {
1132                SystemProperty.class,
1133                EnvironmentVariable.class,
1134                SystemPreference.class,
1135                Argument.class,
1136                Option.class,
1137                Preference.class,
1138                SpecialProperty.class,
1139                INIValue.class
1140            };
1141            for( final var annotationClass : unwantedAnnotations )
1142            {
1143                if( nonNull( getter.getAnnotation( annotationClass ) ) )
1144                {
1145                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, annotationClass.getName(), getter.getSimpleName() ) );
1146                }
1147            }
1148            property.setFlag( GETTER_IS_DEFAULT, GETTER_ON_MAP );
1149        }
1150        var allowsPreferences = !isDefault;
1151
1152        //---* Determine the property type *-----------------------------------
1153        final var rawReturnType = getter.getReturnType();
1154        final var rawPropertyType = determinePropertyType( rawReturnType );
1155        final var propertyType = TypeName.from( rawPropertyType );
1156        final var returnType = TypeName.from( rawReturnType );
1157        property.setPropertyType( propertyType );
1158        final var collectionKind = determineCollectionKind( rawPropertyType );
1159        property.setCollectionKind( collectionKind );
1160        final var isEnum = isEnumType( rawPropertyType );
1161        property.setIsEnum( isEnum );
1162
1163        /*
1164         * Some properties are 'special', and that is reflected by the
1165         * annotation @SpecialProperty.
1166         */
1167        final var specialPropertyAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( SpecialProperty.class );
1168        if( nonNull( specialPropertyAnnotation ) )
1169        {
1170            /*
1171             * No further analysis required because everything is determined by
1172             * the special property spec, even the property name.
1173             */
1174            property.setSpecialPropertyType( specialPropertyAnnotation.value() );
1175        }
1176        else
1177        {
1178            //---* Keep the return type *--------------------------------------
1179            property.setGetterReturnType( returnType );
1180
1181            /*
1182             * Check whether the return type is Optional; only when the return
1183             * type is Optional, it can be different from the property type.
1184             */
1185            if( !returnType.equals( propertyType ) ) property.setFlag( GETTER_RETURNS_OPTIONAL );
1186
1187            /*
1188             * Determine the string converter instance, either from the
1189             * annotation or guess it from the property type.
1190             */
1191            determineStringConverterClass( getter, propertyType, isEnum ).ifPresent( property::setStringConverterClass );
1192
1193            if( !isDefault )
1194            {
1195                //---* Set the field name *------------------------------------
1196                property.setFieldName( composeFieldName( propertyName ) );
1197            }
1198
1199            //---* Additional annotations *------------------------------------
1200            final Optional<INIValue> iniValue = property.getStringConverterClass().isPresent()
1201                ? Optional.ofNullable( getter.getAnnotation( INIValue.class ) )
1202                : Optional.empty();
1203            iniValue.ifPresent( a ->
1204                {
1205                    property.setINIConfiguration( a );
1206                    property.setFlag( ALLOWS_INIFILE, PROPERTY_IS_MUTABLE );
1207                } );
1208            allowsPreferences &= iniValue.isEmpty();
1209
1210            final var systemPropertyAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( SystemProperty.class );
1211            if( nonNull( systemPropertyAnnotation ) )
1212            {
1213                if( iniValue.isPresent() )
1214                {
1215                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, INIValue.class.getName(), getter.getSimpleName() ) );
1216                }
1217
1218                parseSystemPropertyAnnotation( systemPropertyAnnotation, property );
1219
1220                /*
1221                 * System properties may not be stored to/retrieved from
1222                 * preferences or an INIFile.
1223                 */
1224                allowsPreferences = false;
1225            }
1226
1227            final var environmentVariableAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( EnvironmentVariable.class );
1228            if( nonNull( environmentVariableAnnotation ) )
1229            {
1230                if( iniValue.isPresent() )
1231                {
1232                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, INIValue.class.getName(), getter.getSimpleName() ) );
1233                }
1234
1235                /*
1236                 * @SystemProperty and @EnvironmentVariable are mutual
1237                 * exclusive.
1238                 */
1239                if( nonNull( systemPropertyAnnotation ) )
1240                {
1241                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, EnvironmentVariable.class.getName(), getter.getSimpleName() ) );
1242                }
1243
1244                parseEnvironmentVariableAnnotation( environmentVariableAnnotation, property );
1245
1246                /*
1247                 * Environment variable values may not be stored
1248                 * to/retrieved from preferences.
1249                 */
1250                allowsPreferences = false;
1251            }
1252
1253            final var systemPrefsAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( SystemPreference.class );
1254            if( nonNull( systemPrefsAnnotation ) )
1255            {
1256                /*
1257                 * @INIValue, @SystemProperty, @EnvironmentVariable and
1258                 * @SystemPreference are mutual exclusive.
1259                 */
1260                if( nonNull( systemPropertyAnnotation ) || nonNull( environmentVariableAnnotation ) || iniValue.isPresent() )
1261                {
1262                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, SystemPreference.class.getName(), getter.getSimpleName() ) );
1263                }
1264
1265                /*
1266                 * The property will be initialised from a system preference
1267                 * with the name given in the annotation.
1268                 */
1269                property.setSystemPrefsPath( systemPrefsAnnotation.path() );
1270                final var prefsKey = systemPrefsAnnotation.key();
1271                if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( prefsKey ) )
1272                {
1273                    property.setPrefsKey( prefsKey );
1274                }
1275                else
1276                {
1277                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_PrefsKeyMissing, propertyName ) );
1278                }
1279
1280                final var accessorClass = getAnnotationMirror( getter, SystemPreference.class )
1281                    .flatMap( mirror -> getAnnotationValue( mirror, "accessor" ) )
1282                    .map( annotationValue -> TypeName.from( (TypeMirror) annotationValue.getValue() ) )
1283                    .orElseThrow( () -> new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_AccessorMissing, propertyName ) ) );
1284                property.setPrefsAccessorClass( accessorClass );
1285
1286                /*
1287                 * System preference values may not be stored to/retrieved from
1288                 * preferences.
1289                 */
1290                allowsPreferences = false;
1291            }
1292
1293            //---* Process the CLI annotations *-------------------------------
1294            final var argumentAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( Argument.class );
1295            final var optionAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( Option.class );
1296            if( nonNull( argumentAnnotation) && nonNull( optionAnnotation ) )
1297            {
1298                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( MSG_CLIAnnotationClash, optionAnnotation );
1299            }
1300            if( nonNull( argumentAnnotation ) )
1301            {
1302                parseArgumentAnnotation( argumentAnnotation, getter, property );
1303            }
1304            if( nonNull( optionAnnotation ) )
1305            {
1306                parseOptionAnnotation( optionAnnotation, getter, property );
1307            }
1308
1309            //---* Process the preferences annotations *-----------------------
1310            final var noPreferenceAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( NoPreference.class );
1311            final var preferenceAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( Preference.class );
1312            if( !allowsPreferences && nonNull( preferenceAnnotation ) )
1313            {
1314                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, Preference.class.getName(), getter.getSimpleName() ) );
1315            }
1316            if( nonNull(  preferenceAnnotation ) && nonNull( noPreferenceAnnotation ) )
1317            {
1318                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( MSG_PreferenceAnnotationClash, noPreferenceAnnotation );
1319            }
1320            if( nonNull( noPreferenceAnnotation ) ) allowsPreferences = false;
1321            if( allowsPreferences )
1322            {
1323                property.setFlag( ALLOWS_PREFERENCES );
1324
1325                //---* The default values *------------------------------------
1326                var preferenceKey = propertyName;
1327                var accessorClass = PREFS_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
1328
1329                //---* Check the annotation *----------------------------------
1330                if( nonNull( preferenceAnnotation ) )
1331                {
1332                    if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( preferenceAnnotation.key() ) ) preferenceKey = preferenceAnnotation.key();
1333
1334                    try
1335                    {
1336                        final var name = "accessor";
1337                        accessorClass = getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue( getter, Preference.class, name )
1338                            .map( TypeName::from )
1339                            .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_NoValueForMirror, Preference.class.getName(), name ) ) );
1340                    }
1341                    catch( final NoSuchElementException e )
1342                    {
1343                        throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_CannotRetrieveMirror, Preference.class.getName() ), e );
1344                    }
1345                }
1346
1347                //---* Translate the default, if required *--------------------
1348                accessorClass = retrieveAccessorClass( accessorClass, rawPropertyType, collectionKind );
1349
1350                //---* Keep the values *---------------------------------------
1351                property.setPrefsKey( preferenceKey );
1352                property.setPrefsAccessorClass( accessorClass );
1353            }
1354
1355            //---* â¦ and now we create the method spec *-------------------
1356            final var methodBuilder = configuration.getComposer()
1357                .overridingMethodBuilder( getter );
1358            property.setGetterBuilder( methodBuilder );
1359        }
1360    }   //  handleGetter()
1361
1362    /**
1363     *  Processes the given
1364     *  {@link ExecutableElement}
1365     *  instance for a setter method.
1366     *
1367     *  @param  configuration   The code generation configuration.
1368     *  @param  setter  The setter method.
1369     */
1370    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1371    private final void handleSetter( final CodeGenerationConfiguration configuration, final ExecutableElement setter )
1372    {
1373        //---* Get the method name *-------------------------------------------
1374        final var setterMethodName = setter.getSimpleName();
1375
1376        //---* Check for unwanted annotations *--------------------------------
1377        @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
1378        final Class<? extends Annotation> [] unwantedAnnotations = new Class[]
1379        {
1380            SystemProperty.class,
1381            EnvironmentVariable.class,
1382            SystemPreference.class,
1383            Argument.class,
1384            Option.class,
1385            INIValue.class
1386        };
1387        for( final var annotationClass : unwantedAnnotations )
1388        {
1389            if( nonNull( setter.getAnnotation( annotationClass ) ) )
1390            {
1391                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnSetter, annotationClass.getName(), setterMethodName ) );
1392            }
1393        }
1394
1395        //---* Get the property name *-----------------------------------------
1396        final var propertyName = determinePropertyNameFromMethod( setter );
1397
1398        /*
1399         * Let's see if we have such a property already; if not, we have to
1400         * create it.
1401         */
1402        final PropertySpecImpl property;
1403        final TypeName propertyType;
1404        final CollectionKind collectionKind;
1405        ifDebug( "propertyName: %s"::formatted, propertyName );
1406        final var rawArgumentType = setter.getParameters().get( 0 ).asType();
1407        final boolean isEnum;
1408        if( configuration.hasProperty( propertyName ) )
1409        {
1410            ifDebug( "property '%s' exists already"::formatted, propertyName );
1411            try
1412            {
1413                property = (PropertySpecImpl) configuration.getProperty( propertyName ).orElseThrow();
1414            }
1415            catch( final NoSuchElementException e )
1416            {
1417                throw new UnexpectedExceptionError( e );
1418            }
1419            ifDebug( property.hasFlag( PROPERTY_IS_SPECIAL ), "property '%s' is special"::formatted, propertyName );
1420
1421            /*
1422             *  The setter's argument type must match the property type, also
1423             *  for special properties â even when this is checked elsewhere
1424             *  again.
1425             */
1426            propertyType = property.getPropertyType();
1427            if( !propertyType.equals( TypeName.from( setter.getParameters().get( 0 ).asType() ) ) )
1428            {
1429                throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_TypeMismatch, TypeName.from( setter.getParameters().get( 0 ).asType() ).toString(), setterMethodName, propertyType.toString() ) );
1430            }
1431            collectionKind = property.getCollectionKind();
1432            isEnum = property.isEnum();
1433        }
1434        else
1435        {
1436            //---* Create the new property *-----------------------------------
1437            property = new PropertySpecImpl( propertyName );
1438            configuration.addProperty( property );
1439            checkAppropriate( rawArgumentType );
1440            propertyType = TypeName.from( rawArgumentType );
1441            property.setPropertyType( propertyType );
1442            collectionKind = determineCollectionKind( rawArgumentType );
1443            property.setCollectionKind( collectionKind );
1444            isEnum = isEnumType( rawArgumentType );
1445            property.setIsEnum( isEnum );
1446        }
1447
1448        //---* Immutable special properties may not have a setter *------------
1449        if( property.hasFlag( PROPERTY_IS_SPECIAL ) )
1450        {
1451            property.getSpecialPropertyType()
1452                .map( CodeGenerator::getSpecialPropertySpecification )
1453                .filter( spec -> spec.hasFlag( PROPERTY_IS_MUTABLE ) )
1454                .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_IllegalMutator, propertyName ) ) );
1455        }
1456
1457        //---* There is a setter, so the property is mutable *-----------------
1458        property.setFlag( PROPERTY_IS_MUTABLE );
1459        if( configuration.getSynchronizationRequired() ) property.setFlag( PROPERTY_REQUIRES_SYNCHRONIZATION );
1460
1461        //---* Keep the name of the setter method *----------------------------
1462        property.setSetterMethodName( setterMethodName );
1463
1464        //---* Shall the property be added to the result of toString()? *------
1465        if( nonNull( setter.getAnnotation( ExemptFromToString.class ) ) )
1466        {
1467            property.setFlag( EXEMPT_FROM_TOSTRING );
1468        }
1469
1470        /*
1471         * Default setters are handled differently, and they must have a
1472         * corresponding default getter.
1473         */
1474        final var isDefault = setter.getModifiers().contains( DEFAULT );
1475        if( isDefault)
1476        {
1477            if( property.getGetterMethodName().isEmpty() || !property.hasFlag( GETTER_IS_DEFAULT ) )
1478            {
1479                throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_MissingGetter, propertyName ) );
1480            }
1481            property.setFlag( SETTER_IS_DEFAULT );
1482        }
1483
1484        /*
1485         * If this setter is for a special property, we need to check whether
1486         * we have a getter, and whether that getter is for the same special
1487         * property.
1488         */
1489        final var specialPropertyAnnotation = setter.getAnnotation( SpecialProperty.class );
1490        if( nonNull( specialPropertyAnnotation ) )
1491        {
1492            /*
1493             * A default setter cannot be a setter for a special property.
1494             */
1495            if( isDefault ) throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnSetter, SpecialProperty.class.getName(), setterMethodName ) );
1496
1497            final var specialPropertyType = specialPropertyAnnotation.value();
1498            final var specialPropertyTypeOptional = property.getSpecialPropertyType();
1499            if( specialPropertyTypeOptional.isEmpty() )
1500            {
1501                /*
1502                 * No further analysis required because everything is
1503                 * determined by the special property spec, even the property
1504                 * name.
1505                 */
1506                property.setSpecialPropertyType( specialPropertyType );
1507            }
1508            else
1509            {
1510                if( specialPropertyTypeOptional.get() != specialPropertyType )
1511                {
1512                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_SpecialPropertyMismatch, SpecialProperty.class.getName(), setterMethodName, specialPropertyType.name(), specialPropertyTypeOptional.get().name() ) );
1513                }
1514            }
1515        }
1516        else
1517        {
1518            //---* Process the preferences annotations *-----------------------
1519            final var noPreferenceAnnotation = setter.getAnnotation( NoPreference.class );
1520            final var preferenceAnnotation = setter.getAnnotation( Preference.class );
1521            final var allowsPreferences = isNull( noPreferenceAnnotation );
1522
1523            if( nonNull(  preferenceAnnotation ) && nonNull( noPreferenceAnnotation ) )
1524            {
1525                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( MSG_PreferenceAnnotationClash, noPreferenceAnnotation );
1526            }
1527
1528            /*
1529             * If there is a getter for the property, the configuration for
1530             * preferences is already made there.
1531             * For a setter, the preferences annotations are only allowed if
1532             * there is no getter.
1533             */
1534            if( property.getGetterMethodName().isPresent() )
1535            {
1536                /*
1537                 * For a setter, the preferences annotations are only allowed
1538                 * if there is no getter.
1539                 */
1540                if( nonNull( preferenceAnnotation ) || nonNull( noPreferenceAnnotation ) )
1541                {
1542                    final var currentAnnotation = nonNull( preferenceAnnotation ) ? preferenceAnnotation : noPreferenceAnnotation;
1543                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnSetter, currentAnnotation.getClass().getName(), setterMethodName ) );
1544                }
1545            }
1546            else
1547            {
1548                if( allowsPreferences )
1549                {
1550                    property.setFlag( ALLOWS_PREFERENCES );
1551
1552                    //---* The default values *--------------------------------
1553                    var preferenceKey = propertyName;
1554                    var accessorClass = PREFS_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
1555
1556                    //---* Check the annotation *------------------------------
1557                    if( nonNull( preferenceAnnotation ) )
1558                    {
1559                        if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( preferenceAnnotation.key() ) ) preferenceKey = preferenceAnnotation.key();
1560
1561                        try
1562                        {
1563                            final var name = "accessor";
1564                            accessorClass = getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue( setter, Preference.class, name )
1565                                .map( TypeName::from )
1566                                .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_NoValueForMirror, Preference.class.getName(), name ) ) );
1567                        }
1568                        catch( final NoSuchElementException e )
1569                        {
1570                            throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_CannotRetrieveMirror, Preference.class.getName() ), e );
1571                        }
1572                    }
1573
1574                    //---* Translate the default, if required *--------------------
1575                    accessorClass = retrieveAccessorClass( accessorClass, rawArgumentType, collectionKind );
1576
1577                    //---* Keep the values *-----------------------------------
1578                    property.setPrefsKey( preferenceKey );
1579                    property.setPrefsAccessorClass( accessorClass );
1580                }
1581            }
1582
1583            /*
1584             * Determine the string converter instance, either from the
1585             * annotation or guess it from the property type.
1586             */
1587            final var stringConverterOptional = determineStringConverterClass( setter, propertyType, isEnum );
1588            property.getStringConverterClass()
1589                .ifPresentOrElse( stringConverterClass ->
1590                {
1591                    final var error = new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_StringConverterMismatch, setterMethodName ) );
1592                    if( !stringConverterClass.equals( stringConverterOptional.orElseThrow( () -> error ) ) ) throw error;
1593                },
1594                () -> stringConverterOptional.ifPresent( property::setStringConverterClass ) );
1595
1596            //---* Configure the setter *--------------------------------------
1597            final var checkEmptyAnnotation = setter.getAnnotation( CheckEmpty.class );
1598            final var checkNullAnnotation = setter.getAnnotation( CheckNull.class );
1599
1600            /*
1601             * The annotations @CheckEmpty and @CheckNull are mutually
1602             * exclusive, although non-empty forces also not-null.
1603             */
1604            if( nonNull( checkNullAnnotation ) && nonNull( checkEmptyAnnotation ) )
1605            {
1606                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnSetter, CheckNull.class.getName(), setterMethodName ) );
1607            }
1608            if( nonNull( checkEmptyAnnotation ) )
1609            {
1610                if( isDefault )
1611                {
1612                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnSetter, CheckEmpty.class.getName(), setter.getSimpleName() ) );
1613                }
1614                property.setFlag( SETTER_CHECK_EMPTY );
1615            }
1616            if( nonNull( checkNullAnnotation ) )
1617            {
1618                if( isDefault )
1619                {
1620                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnSetter, CheckNull.class.getName(), setter.getSimpleName() ) );
1621                }
1622                property.setFlag( SETTER_CHECK_NULL );
1623            }
1624        }
1625
1626        //---* Create the setter's argument *----------------------------------
1627        property.setSetterArgumentName( retrieveSetterArgumentName( setter ) );
1628
1629        //---* â¦ and now we create the method spec *---------------------------
1630        final var methodBuilder = configuration.getComposer()
1631            .overridingMethodBuilder( setter );
1632        property.setSetterBuilder( methodBuilder );
1633    }   //  handleSetter()
1634
1635    /**
1636     *  Initialises the internal attribute
1637     *  {@link #m_StringConvertersForTypeNames}.
1638     *
1639     *  @return The map of
1640     *      {@link StringConverter}
1641     *      implementations.
1642     */
1643    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.1.0" )
1644    private final Map<TypeName,ClassName> initStringConvertersForTypeNames()
1645    {
1646        final Map<TypeName,ClassName> retValue;
1647        try
1648        {
1649            retValue = createStringConverterRegistry();
1650        }
1651        catch( final IOException e )
1652        {
1653            throw new ExceptionInInitializerError( e );
1654        }
1655        ifDebug( retValue.isEmpty(), $ -> "No StringConverters??" );
1656
1657        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1658        return retValue;
1659    }   //  initStringConvertersForTypeNames()
1660
1661    /**
1662     *  Parses the given annotation and updates the given property accordingly.
1663     *
1664     *  @param  annotation  The annotation.
1665     *  @param  method  The annotated method.
1666     *  @param  property    The property.
1667     */
1668    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1669    private final void parseArgumentAnnotation( final Argument annotation, final ExecutableElement method, final PropertySpecImpl property )
1670    {
1671        property.setFlag( PROPERTY_IS_ARGUMENT );
1672
1673        //---* The index *-----------------------------------------------------
1674        property.setCLIArgumentIndex( annotation.index() );
1675
1676        //---* The other fields *----------------------------------------------
1677        parseCLIAnnotation( annotation, method, property );
1678    }   //  parseArgumentAnnotation()
1679
1680    /**
1681     *  <p>{@summary Parses the given CLI annotation and updates the given
1682     *  property accordingly.}</p>
1683     *  <p>{@code annotation} may be only of type
1684     *  {@link Argument}
1685     *  or
1686     *  {@link Option},
1687     *  although this is not explicitly checked (the method is private!).</p>
1688     *  <p>Usually, the method is only called by the methods
1689     *  {@link #parseArgumentAnnotation(Argument, ExecutableElement, PropertySpecImpl)}
1690     *  and
1691     *  {@link #parseOptionAnnotation(Option, ExecutableElement, PropertySpecImpl)},
1692     *  with the proper arguments.</p>
1693     *
1694     *  @param  annotation  The annotation.
1695     *  @param  method  The annotated method.
1696     *  @param  property    The property.
1697     */
1698    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1699    private final void parseCLIAnnotation( final Annotation annotation, @SuppressWarnings( "TypeMayBeWeakened" ) final ExecutableElement method, final PropertySpecImpl property )
1700    {
1701        final var annotationMirror = getAnnotationMirror( method, annotation.getClass() )
1702            .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_CannotRetrieveMirror, annotation.getClass().getName() ) ) );
1703
1704        //---* The value handler class *---------------------------------------
1705        {
1706            final var name = "handler";
1707            final var annotationValue = getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1708                .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_NoValueForMirror, annotation.getClass().getName(), name ) ) );
1709            final var defaultClass = getTypeUtils().erasure( getElementUtils().getTypeElement( CmdLineValueHandler.class.getName() ).asType() );
1710            final var handlerClass = getTypeUtils().erasure( (TypeMirror) annotationValue.getValue() );
1711            if( !getTypeUtils().isSameType( defaultClass, handlerClass ) )
1712            {
1713                property.setCLIValueHandlerClass( TypeName.from( handlerClass ) );
1714            }
1715        }
1716
1717        //---* The format *----------------------------------------------------
1718        {
1719            final var name = "format";
1720            getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1721                .map( v -> (String) v.getValue() )
1722                .ifPresent( v -> property.setCLIFormat( isNotEmptyOrBlank( v ) ? v : null ) );
1723        }
1724
1725        //---* The meta var *--------------------------------------------------
1726        {
1727            final var name = "metaVar";
1728            getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1729                .map( v -> (String) v.getValue() )
1730                .ifPresent( v -> property.setCLIMetaVar( isNotEmptyOrBlank( v ) ? v : null ) );
1731        }
1732
1733        //---* The multi-valued flag *-----------------------------------------
1734        {
1735            final var name = "multiValued";
1736            final var flag = getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1737                .map( v -> (Boolean) v.getValue() )
1738                .orElse( FALSE )
1739                .booleanValue();
1740            if( flag ) property.setFlag( PROPERTY_CLI_MULTIVALUED );
1741        }
1742
1743        //---* The required flag *---------------------------------------------
1744        {
1745            final var name = "required";
1746            final var flag = getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1747                .map( v -> (Boolean) v.getValue() )
1748                .orElse( FALSE )
1749                .booleanValue();
1750            if( flag ) property.setFlag( PROPERTY_CLI_MANDATORY );
1751        }
1752
1753        //---* The usage text *------------------------------------------------
1754        {
1755            final var name = "usage";
1756            getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1757                .map( v -> (String) v.getValue() )
1758                .ifPresent( v -> property.setCLIUsage( isNotEmptyOrBlank( v ) ? v : null ) );
1759        }
1760
1761        //---* The usage text *------------------------------------------------
1762        {
1763            final var name = "usageKey";
1764            getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1765                .map( v -> (String) v.getValue() )
1766                .ifPresent( v -> property.setCLIUsageKey( isNotEmptyOrBlank( v ) ? v : null ) );
1767        }
1768    }   //  parseCLIAnnotation()
1769
1770    /**
1771     *  Parses the given annotation and updates the given property accordingly.
1772     *
1773     *  @param  annotation  The annotation.
1774     *  @param  property    The property.
1775     */
1776    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1777    private final void parseEnvironmentVariableAnnotation( final EnvironmentVariable annotation, final PropertySpecImpl property )
1778    {
1779        /*
1780         * The property will be initialised from an environment
1781         * variable with the name given in the annotation.
1782         */
1783        property.setEnvironmentVariableName( annotation.value() );
1784
1785        //---* Set the default value *-----------------------------------------
1786        property.setEnvironmentDefaultValue( annotation.defaultValue() );
1787    }   //  parseEnvironmentVariableAnnotation()
1788
1789    /**
1790     *  Parses the given annotation and updates the given property accordingly.
1791     *
1792     *  @param  annotation  The annotation.
1793     *  @param  method  The annotated method.
1794     *  @param  property    The property.
1795     */
1796    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1797    private final void parseOptionAnnotation( final Option annotation, final ExecutableElement method, final PropertySpecImpl property )
1798    {
1799        property.setFlag( PROPERTY_IS_OPTION );
1800
1801        //---* The name and aliases *------------------------------------------
1802        final List<String> names = new ArrayList<>();
1803        names.add( annotation.name() );
1804        names.addAll( asList( annotation.aliases() ) );
1805        property.setCLIOptionNames( names );
1806
1807        //---* The other fields *----------------------------------------------
1808        parseCLIAnnotation( annotation, method, property );
1809    }   //  parseOptionAnnotation()
1810
1811    /**
1812     *  Parses the given annotation and updates the given property accordingly.
1813     *
1814     *  @param  annotation  The annotation.
1815     *  @param  property    The property.
1816     */
1817    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1818    private final void parseSystemPropertyAnnotation( final SystemProperty annotation, final PropertySpecImpl property )
1819    {
1820        /*
1821         * The property will be initialised from a system property with
1822         * the name given in the annotation.
1823         */
1824        property.setSystemPropertyName( annotation.value() );
1825
1826        //---* Set the default value *-----------------------------------------
1827        property.setEnvironmentDefaultValue( annotation.defaultValue() );
1828    }   //  parseSystemPropertyAnnotation()
1829
1830    /**
1831     *  {@inheritDoc}
1832     */
1833    @Override
1834    public final boolean process( final Set<? extends TypeElement> annotations, final RoundEnvironment roundEnvironment )
1835    {
1836        //---* Tell them who we are *------------------------------------------
1837        final var message = annotations.isEmpty() ? "No annotations to process" : annotations.stream()
1838            .map( TypeElement::getQualifiedName )
1839            .collect( joining( "', '", "Processing the annotation" + (annotations.size() > 1 ? "s '" : " '"), "'" ) );
1840        printMessage( NOTE, message );
1841
1842        final var retValue = !roundEnvironment.errorRaised() && !annotations.isEmpty();
1843        if( retValue )
1844        {
1845            if( !annotations.isEmpty() )
1846            {
1847                /*
1848                 * Get the values for the i18n annotations and keep them.
1849                 */
1850                //---* Get the message prefix *--------------------------------
1851                m_MessagePrefix = retrieveAnnotatedField( roundEnvironment, MessagePrefix.class )
1852                    .filter( variableElement -> variableElement.getModifiers().containsAll( Set.of( PUBLIC, STATIC ) ) )
1853                    .map( variableElement -> format( "%s.%s", variableElement.getEnclosingElement(), variableElement.getSimpleName() ) );
1854
1855                //---* Get the base bundle name *------------------------------
1856                m_BaseBundleName = retrieveAnnotatedField( roundEnvironment, BaseBundleName.class )
1857                    .filter( variableElement -> variableElement.getModifiers().containsAll( Set.of( PUBLIC, STATIC ) ) )
1858                    .map( variableElement -> format( "%s.%s", variableElement.getEnclosingElement(), variableElement.getSimpleName() ) );
1859
1860                /*
1861                 * Process the elements that are annotated as configuration
1862                 * bean specification. Although not more than one per
1863                 * application seems logical, it could easily be more than one.
1864                 */
1865                ScanLoop: for( final var element : roundEnvironment.getElementsAnnotatedWith( ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class ) )
1866                {
1867                    /*
1868                     * We are only interested in elements that are type
1869                     * elements, and to be honest, we only want interfaces.
1870                     */
1871                    if( element instanceof TypeElement typeElement )
1872                    {
1873                        if( typeElement.getKind() == ElementKind.INTERFACE )
1874                        {
1875                            //---* Create the configuration bean *-------------
1876                            try
1877                            {
1878                                processConfigurationBeanSpecification( typeElement );
1879                            }
1880                            catch( final IOException e )
1881                            {
1882                                printMessage( ERROR, e.toString(), element );
1883                            }
1884                        }
1885                        else
1886                        {
1887                            printMessage( ERROR, format( "%s: Only interfaces may be annotated with '%s'", typeElement.getQualifiedName().toString(), ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class.getSimpleName() ), element );
1888                            throw new IllegalAnnotationError( MSG_InterfacesOnly, ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class );
1889                        }
1890                    }
1891                    else
1892                    {
1893                        printMessage( ERROR, format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationUse, element.getSimpleName().toString(), ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class.getSimpleName() ), element );
1894                        throw new IllegalAnnotationError( ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class );
1895                    }
1896                }   //  ScanLoop:
1897            }
1898        }
1899
1900        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1901        return retValue;
1902    }   //  process()
1903
1904    /**
1905     *  Processes the given configuration bean specification and generates the
1906     *  source for the so specified configuration bean.
1907     *
1908     *  @param  specification   The specification interface.
1909     *  @throws IOException A problem occurred when writing the source file.
1910     */
1911    private final void processConfigurationBeanSpecification( final TypeElement specification ) throws IOException
1912    {
1913        //---* Create the composer *-------------------------------------------
1914        final var composer = new JavaComposer( LAYOUT_FOUNDATION, addDebugOutput() );
1915
1916        final var specificationAnnotation = specification.getAnnotation( ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class );
1917
1918        //---* Determine the simple name of the bean class *-------------------
1919        final var configurationBeanClassName = getElementUtils().getName( isEmpty( specificationAnnotation.name() ) ? format( "%sImpl", specification.getSimpleName() ) : specificationAnnotation.name() );
1920        final var isSamePackage = specificationAnnotation.samePackage();
1921
1922        //---* Do we need to synchronise the access to the properties? *-------
1923        final var synchronizeAccess = specificationAnnotation.synchronizeAccess();
1924
1925        //---* Get the base class *--------------------------------------------
1926        TypeName baseClass = null;
1927        try
1928        {
1929            final var annotationValueName = "baseClass";
1930            baseClass = getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue( specification, ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class, annotationValueName )
1931                .map( TypeName::from )
1932                .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_NoValueForMirror, ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class.getName(), annotationValueName ) ) );
1933        }
1934        catch( final NoSuchElementException e )
1935        {
1936            throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_CannotRetrieveMirror, ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class.getName() ), e );
1937        }
1938        if( TypeName.from( Object.class ).equals( baseClass ) )
1939        {
1940            //noinspection AssignmentToNull
1941            baseClass = null;
1942        }
1943
1944        /*
1945         * Determine the name of the package for the bean class. As the
1946         * interface may be an inner type, we cannot just take the next best
1947         * enclosing element.
1948         */
1949        var parentElement = specification;
1950        while( parentElement.getNestingKind() != NestingKind.TOP_LEVEL )
1951        {
1952            parentElement = (TypeElement) specification.getEnclosingElement();
1953        }
1954        final var packageElement = (PackageElement) specification.getEnclosingElement();
1955        final var specificationPackageName = packageElement.getQualifiedName().toString();
1956        final var configurationBeanPackageName = getElementUtils().getName
1957            (
1958                isSamePackage
1959                ? specificationPackageName
1960                : packageElement.isUnnamed()
1961                  ? PACKAGE_NAME
1962                  : format( "%s.%s", specificationPackageName, PACKAGE_NAME )
1963            );
1964
1965        //---* Create the configuration for the code generation *--------------
1966        final var specificationClass = ClassName.from( specification );
1967        final var configuration = new CodeGenerationConfiguration( this, composer, specificationClass, configurationBeanClassName, configurationBeanPackageName, baseClass, synchronizeAccess );
1968
1969        //---* Determine the name for the initialisation data resource *-------
1970        var initDataResource = specificationAnnotation.initDataResource();
1971        if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( initDataResource ) )
1972        {
1973            if( "=".equals( initDataResource ) ) initDataResource = format( "%s.properties", specification.getSimpleName() );
1974            configuration.setInitDataResource( initDataResource );
1975        }
1976
1977        //---* Retrieve the method for the initialisation *--------------------
1978        retrieveInitDataMethod( configuration, specification );
1979
1980        /*
1981         * Retrieve all the interfaces that are implemented by the
1982         * specification.
1983         */
1984        final Set<TypeElement> interfaces = new HashSet<>();
1985        retrieveInterfaces( specification, interfaces );
1986        final var interfacesTypes = interfaces.stream()
1987            .map( element -> TypeName.from( element.asType() ) )
1988            .collect( Collectors.toList() );
1989        configuration.addInterfacesToImplement( interfacesTypes );
1990
1991        //---* Retrieve the properties *---------------------------------------
1992        retrieveProperties( configuration, interfaces );
1993
1994        //---* Add the settings for the I18nSupport *--------------------------
1995        if( configuration.implementInterface( I18nSupport.class ) )
1996        {
1997            configuration.setI18NParameters( m_MessagePrefix.orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( MSG_NoMessagePrefix ) ),
1998                m_BaseBundleName.orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( MSG_NoBaseBundleName ) ) );
1999        }
2000
2001        //---* Determine the settings for the preferences stuff *--------------
2002        final var preferencesRootAnnotation = specification.getAnnotation( PreferencesRoot.class );
2003        if( nonNull( preferencesRootAnnotation ) )
2004        {
2005            configuration.setPreferencesRoot( preferencesRootAnnotation.nodeName() );
2006            try
2007            {
2008                getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue( specification, PreferencesRoot.class, "changeListenerClass" )
2009                    .map( TypeName::from )
2010                    .ifPresent( configuration::setPreferenceChangeListenerClass );
2011            }
2012            catch( final NoSuchElementException e )
2013            {
2014                throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_CannotRetrieveMirror, PreferencesRoot.class.getName() ), e );
2015            }
2016        }
2017
2018        //---* Determine the settings for the {@code INI} file stuff *---------
2019        final var iniFileConfig = specification.getAnnotation( INIFileConfig.class );
2020        if( nonNull( iniFileConfig ) )
2021        {
2022            final Path path;
2023            try
2024            {
2025                path = PathStringConverter.INSTANCE.fromString( iniFileConfig.path() );
2026            }
2027            catch( final IllegalArgumentException e )
2028            {
2029                throw new CodeGenerationError( MSG_INIPathMissing, e );
2030            }
2031            if( isNull( path ) )
2032            {
2033                throw new CodeGenerationError( MSG_INIPathMissing );
2034            }
2035            configuration.setINIFileConfig( path, iniFileConfig.mustExist(), iniFileConfig.comment() );
2036            for( final var group : specification.getAnnotationsByType( INIGroup.class ) ) configuration.addINIGroup( group );
2037        }
2038
2039        //---* Create the source code *----------------------------------------
2040        try
2041        {
2042            final var generator = new CodeGenerator( configuration );
2043            final var javaFile = generator.createCode();
2044
2045            //---* Write the source file *-------------------------------------
2046            javaFile.writeTo( getFiler() );
2047        }
2048        catch( @SuppressWarnings( "OverlyBroadCatchBlock" ) final Exception e )
2049        {
2050            /*
2051             * Any exception that makes it to this point indicates a failure of
2052             * the code generation process.
2053             */
2054            printMessage( ERROR, format( "Code Generation failed: %s", e.getMessage() ), specification );
2055            throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_CodeGenerationFailed, configurationBeanPackageName, configurationBeanClassName ), e );
2056        }
2057    }   //  processConfigurationBeanSpecification()
2058
2059    /**
2060     *  Retrieves the class for the preference accessor.
2061     *
2062     *  @param  accessorType    The accessor class as defined in the
2063     *      annotation; if this is
2064     *      {@link PreferenceAccessor PreferenceAccessor.class},
2065     *      the effective handler class has to inferred from the
2066     *      {@code propertyType}.
2067     *  @param  propertyType    The type of the property that should be
2068     *      accessed.
2069     *  @param collectionKind   The kind of collection that is represented by
2070     *      the property type.
2071     *  @return The effective accessor class.
2072     *  @throws IllegalAnnotationError  There is no accessor for the given
2073     *      property type.
2074     */
2075    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.1" )
2076    private final TypeName retrieveAccessorClass( final TypeName accessorType, final TypeMirror propertyType, final CollectionKind collectionKind ) throws IllegalAnnotationError
2077    {
2078        var retValue = accessorType;
2079        if( isNull( accessorType ) || accessorType.equals( PREFS_ACCESSOR_TYPE ) )
2080        {
2081            //---* Infer the effective accessor class from the property type *-
2082            if( isEnumType( propertyType ) )
2083            {
2084                retValue = ENUM_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
2085            }
2086            else
2087            {
2088                retValue = switch( collectionKind )
2089                {
2090                    case NO_COLLECTION -> m_PrefsAccessorClasses.getOrDefault( TypeName.from( propertyType ), (ClassName) DEFAULT_ACCESSOR_TYPE );
2091                    case LIST -> LIST_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
2092                    case MAP -> MAP_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
2093                    case SET -> SET_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
2094                };
2095            }
2096        }
2097
2098        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2099        return retValue;
2100    }   //  retrieveAccessorClass()
2101
2102    /**
2103     *  <p>{@summary This methods checks whether the configuration bean
2104     *  specification specifies an {@code initData()} method.} This method has
2105     *  to meet the requirements below:</p>
2106     *  <ul>
2107     *  <li>the name has to be
2108     *  {@value #METHODNAME_ConfigBeanSpec_InitData}</li>
2109     *  <li>it does not take any arguments</li>
2110     *  <li>it returns an instance of {@code Map<String,Object>}</li>
2111     *  <li>it is either {@code static} or {@code default} or implemented in a
2112     *  base class, although this is not checked here</li>
2113     *  </ul>
2114     *  <p>Is such a method exists, a
2115     *  {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.MethodSpec}
2116     *  for it will be created and added to the configuration.</p>
2117     *
2118     *  @param  configuration   The configuration for the code generation.
2119     *  @param  specification   The configuration bean specification interface.
2120     *
2121     *  @note   If a base class for the new configuration bean is defined, the
2122     *      method may be abstract, but if that base class does not implement
2123     *      the method it will be detected only by the final compiler run, not
2124     *      by the code generation here.
2125     */
2126    @SuppressWarnings( {"TypeMayBeWeakened", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
2127    private final void retrieveInitDataMethod( final CodeGenerationConfiguration configuration, final TypeElement specification )
2128    {
2129        final var hasBaseClass = configuration.getBaseClass().isPresent();
2130        final var returnType = ParameterizedTypeName.from( Map.class, String.class, Object.class );
2131        final var method = specification.getEnclosedElements().stream()
2132            // We are only interested in methods.
2133            .filter( e -> e.getKind() == METHOD )
2134            // Methods are executable elements
2135            .map( e -> (ExecutableElement) e )
2136            /*
