2137             * The method has to be either default or static; these modifiers
2138             * are mutually exclusive, so the method has either one or the
2139             * other, or it is abstract, having neither of default or static.
2140             */
2141            .filter( e -> hasBaseClass || e.getModifiers().contains( DEFAULT ) || e.getModifiers().contains( STATIC ) )
2142            // The name of the method should be "initData"
2143            .filter( e -> e.getSimpleName().contentEquals( METHODNAME_ConfigBeanSpec_InitData ) )
2144            // The method may not take any arguments
2145            .filter( e -> e.getParameters().isEmpty() )
2146            // The return type has to be Map<String,Object>
2147            .filter( e -> TypeName.from( e.getReturnType() ) instanceof ParameterizedTypeName )
2148            .filter( e -> returnType.equals( TypeName.from( e.getReturnType() ) ) )
2149            .findFirst();
2150
2151        method.map( m -> configuration.getComposer().createMethod( m ) )
2152            .ifPresent( configuration::setInitDataMethod );
2153    }   //  retrieveInitDataMethod()
2154
2155    /**
2156     *  <p>{@summary Scans the configuration bean specification for the
2157     *  properties and stores the result to the configuration.}</p>
2158     *  <p>A property is defined primarily by the respective
2159     *  {@linkplain org.tquadrat.foundation.function.Getter getter}
2160     *  method with its annotations, but it is also possible to define it by a
2161     *  {@linkplain org.tquadrat.foundation.function.Setter setter}
2162     *  method only â especially when the configuration bean specification
2163     *  extends the interface
2164     *  {@link java.util.Map}.</p>
2165     *
2166     *  @param  configuration   The code generation configuration.
2167     *  @param  interfaces  The interfaces that have to implemented by the new
2168     *      configuration bean.
2169     */
2170    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
2171    private final void retrieveProperties( final CodeGenerationConfiguration configuration, final Collection<? extends TypeElement> interfaces )
2172    {
2173        final var isMap = configuration.implementInterface( Map.class );
2174
2175        /*
2176         * Retrieve getters, setters and 'add' methods from the interfaces.
2177         */
2178        final Collection<ExecutableElement> getters = new ArrayList<>();
2179        final Collection<ExecutableElement> setters = new ArrayList<>();
2180        final Collection<ExecutableElement> addMethods = new ArrayList<>();
2181        interfaces.stream()
2182            .flatMap( i -> i.getEnclosedElements().stream() )
2183            .filter( e -> e.getKind() == METHOD )
2184            .map( e -> (ExecutableElement) e )
2185            .forEach( element ->
2186            {
2187                if( isGetter( element ) )
2188                {
2189                    /*
2190                     * There is a method Map.isEmpty(); if the configuration
2191                     * bean specification extends java.util.Map, this is not a
2192                     * property getter for the 'empty' property.
2193                     * If isMap == true, the method isEmpty() will be
2194                     * implemented elsewhere.
2195                     */
2196                    if( !element.getSimpleName().toString().equals( METHODNAME_Map_IsEmpty ) || !isMap )
2197                    {
2198                        getters.add( element );
2199                    }
2200                }
2201                else if( isSetter( element ) )
2202                {
2203                    setters.add( element );
2204                }
2205                else if( isAddMethod( element ) )
2206                {
2207                    /*
2208                     * There is a method ConfigBeanSpec.addListener() that is
2209                     * necessary for the listener management, and not an 'add'
2210                     * method for a property. Therefore, it will be implemented
2211                     * elsewhere.
2212                     */
2213                    if( !element.getSimpleName().toString().equals( METHODNAME_ConfigBeanSpec_AddListener ) )
2214                    {
2215                        addMethods.add( element );
2216                    }
2217                }
2218            } );
2219
2220        /*
2221         *  Getters are to be processed first.
2222         *  This will create the properties that are stored in the
2223         *  configuration.
2224         */
2225        getters.forEach( getter -> handleGetter( configuration, getter ) );
2226
2227        //---* Process the setters *-------------------------------------------
2228        setters.forEach( setter -> handleSetter( configuration, setter ) );
2229
2230        //---* Process the 'add' methods *-------------------------------------
2231        addMethods.forEach( addMethod -> handleAddMethod( configuration, addMethod ) );
2232    }   //  retrieveProperties()
2233
2234    /**
2235     *  <p>{@summary Retrieves the name of the single argument of a setter
2236     *  method.}</p>
2237     *  <p>This method will return the name of the argument as defined in the
2238     *  configuration bean specification if the compiler flag
2239     *  {@code -parameters} is set; otherwise, the arguments are just counted
2240     *  ({@code arg0}, {@code arg1}, {@code arg2}, â¦).</p>
2241     *
2242     *  @param  setter  The setter method.
2243     *  @return The name of the argument as defined in the configuration bean
2244     *      specification, or &quot;arg0&quot;
2245     */
2246    private final Name retrieveSetterArgumentName( final ExecutableElement setter )
2247    {
2248        final var parameters = retrieveArgumentNames( setter );
2249        if( parameters.size() != 1 ) throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_NoSetter, setter.getSimpleName() ) );
2250        final var retValue = parameters.get( 0 );
2251
2252        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2253        return retValue;
2254    }   //  retrieveSetterArgumentName()
2255
2256    /**
2257     *  <p>{@summary Determines the key class for the given instance of
2258     *  {@link StringConverter}.}</p>
2259     *
2260     *  @note   This method was copied from
2261     *      {@code org.tquadrat.foundation.base/org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.internal.StringConverterService}.
2262     *
2263     *  @param  converter   The converter instance.
2264     *  @return The subject class.
2265     */
2266    @SuppressWarnings( {"NestedTryStatement", "unchecked"} )
2267    private static final Collection<Class<?>> retrieveSubjectClasses( final StringConverter<?> converter )
2268    {
2269        final var converterClass = requireNonNullArgument( converter, "converter" ).getClass();
2270        Collection<Class<?>> retValue;
2271        try
2272        {
2273            try
2274            {
2275                final var getSubjectClassMethod = converterClass.getMethod( METHOD_NAME_GetSubjectClass );
2276                //noinspection unchecked
2277                retValue = (Collection<Class<?>>) getSubjectClassMethod.invoke( converter );
2278            }
2279            catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final NoSuchMethodException e )
2280            {
2281                final var fromStringMethod = converterClass.getMethod( "fromString", CharSequence.class );
2282                retValue = List.of( fromStringMethod.getReturnType() );
2283            }
2284        }
2285        catch( final NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException | IllegalAccessException | InvocationTargetException e )
2286        {
2287            throw new UnexpectedExceptionError( e );
2288        }
2289
2290        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2291        return retValue;
2292    }   //  retrieveSubjectClass()
2293}
2294//  class ConfigAnnotationProcessor
